documentation: # Mailmodo This guide walks you through setting up the Mailmodo integration within Boltic. ## Prerequisites To set up the Mailmodo integration, you'll need: - A Mailmodo account - The Mailmodo API Key ## Setting Up the Mailmodo Integration in Boltic 1. **Log In** - Log into your Mailmodo account. 2. **Obtain API Key** - Navigate to **Integrations** from the vertical menu on the left. - Under **Available for Connection**, locate **Make** and click the authentication CTA. - Copy the API Key from the displayed Make Integration window. 3. **Log into Boltic** - Log into your Boltic account or navigate to the Boltic Open Source dashboard. 4. **Navigate to Integrations** - Click on `Sources` and then click on `+ Add New source`. 5. **Select Source Type** - On the Set up the source page, search for `Mailmodo` from the search bar and select it. 6. **Configure Integration** - **Name:** Enter a name for the Mailmodo integration. - **API Key:** Paste the API Key copied from Mailmodo. 7. **Details (Optional)** - **Tags:** Add any tags for categorization. - **Description:** Provide a brief description of the integration. 8. **Test and Save Integration** - Click `Test Connection` to ensure the provided details are correct and the connection is successful. - Once the connection test is successful, click `Set up source` to complete the configuration. ## Setting Up Mailmodo Webhooks Mailmodo uses webhooks to trigger a scenario when an event occurs. To set up a webhook: 1. Add a Mailmodo instant module to your scenario and click **Create a webhook**. 2. **Webhook Name:** Enter a name for the webhook (optional). 3. **Connection:** Select the corresponding connection for the webhook. 4. Click **Save** and then **Copy address to clipboard**. 5. Log in to your Mailmodo account and follow the relevant setup instructions in the Mailmodo support articles. 6. Use the provided webhook URL in the respective workflow setup in Mailmodo. ## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. **How do I find my Mailmodo API Key?** - Log into your Mailmodo account, go to Integrations, and copy the API Key from the Make Integration window. Follow the instructions provided earlier in this guide. 2. **What should I do if my connection fails?** - Ensure your API Key is correct. - Verify that the API Key is correctly entered in the Boltic configuration. - Check your network connection and firewall settings. 3. **How often is the data synced?** - The data sync frequency is determined by the settings configured during setup. You can customize the sync frequency as needed. 4. **Can I customize the data being synced?** - Yes, you can customize the data being synced by adjusting the settings during the setup process. ## Support If you need further assistance, please contact Boltic support or visit our Support Documentation.

meta.description: Refer to the Mailmodo API authenticaton documentation for detailed instructions on getting your API key.
